noun.description: An individual leaf of paper or parchment, numbered on the recto or front side only, occurring either loose as one of a series or forming part of a bound volume.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin, ablative of folium leaf, in medieval Latin used in references to mean on leaf so-and-so. The original sense of in folio (from Italian in foglio) was in the form of a full-sized sheet or leaf folded once (designating the largest size of book).
